text: William Jermaine Stewart (September 7, 1957 - March 17, 1997) was an American singer. He was born in Columbus, Ohio and moved to Chicago, Illinois in 1972. He is best known for his song We Don't Have to Take Our Clothes Off, which was released in 1986. He died of AIDS in Homewood, Illinois. == Other websites == * Category:1957 births Category:1997 deaths Category:African-American musicians Category:American dancers Category:American R&B; singers Category:American singer-songwriters Category:Deaths from AIDS Category:Infectious disease deaths in Illinois Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:Singers from Ohio
title: Jermaine Stewart
